channel.title: How can i fix this cache error
channel.description:
Finished downloading TSCAPEV1.zip! java.io.FileNotFoundException: c:\yourservername\Animations\frames\0.dat (The sy stem cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.(Unknown Source) at CacheDownloader.unzip(CacheDownloader.java:191) at CacheDownloader.unZip(CacheDownloader.java:177) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:81) at client.startUp(client.java:7334) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:4790) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) UNZIP
How can I fix this? Then it goes to a reconnecting in 5...4...3....2...1 etc

item.title: How can i fix this cache error
item.dc:creator: @jaspernuts jaspernuts
item.description:
@jaspernuts wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:4, topic:540778”][quote author=jaspernuts link=topic=659644.msg4411156#msg4411156 date=1393761395]

Make sure c:\yourservername\Animations\frames\0.dat exists?

It does, I don’t understand why it’s happening. It’s never happened to me before.
[/quote]I think you renamed something, try re-downloading your client/cache etc.[/quote]
I did that, I’m using Hybrid pvp v2 (I know its leeched but yano, memories) and I’ve redownloaded it and everything and get the same error, i did it 2 years ago and didn’t get the problem I have now.

Read full topic
item.source: How can i fix this cache error

Make sure c:\yourservername\Animations\frames\0.dat exists?
[/quote]
It does, I don’t understand why it’s happening. It’s never happened to me before.[/quote]I think you renamed something, try re-downloading your client/cache etc.
